subject: Support for multiple Include/Exclude categories
msgSnippet: Hi! I am a user of JUnit and project contributor in github. I am glad to say that we extended Categories with new feature in pull request
messageBody:
Hi! I am a user of JUnit and project contributor in github.

I am glad to say that we extended Categories with new feature in pull request https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/pull/503
This extension is not yet in KentBeck repo, however the implementation and tests are ready.

In JUnit we got a consensus of anotations design and behavior, but we do not have consensus in javadoc for Categories class.

We would like to ask you to have a look and help us refine the Javadoc, which finally would help to all users of JUnit.

Our main goal is to declare many inclusive/exclusive categories on the top of a test suite, unlike the old Categories.java runner which used just only one category.

There is Maven community with surefire-plugin, which may use this extension known as groups -currently they only use a single group.

Note: you'r welcome to login to www.github.com and contribute to the pull #503 i mentioned above.

Thx, Tibor
